name: onion production | onion | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/15752/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of fresh Onion during December, 2016 -April, 2017 at a farm located in village Vadner Bhairav, District Nashik of Maharashtra. In this area, fields are irrigated with ground water using electric pump for surface irrigation. The farm has a yield of 43,750 kg fresh matter per ha for this crop cycle. Sowing date for the crop is 28-December, 2016 and harvesting date is 15-April, 2017. Mineral NPK fertilizer input is 105-198.75-215 kg/ha. Herbicide used has active ingredient as Oxyfluorfen 150g/ha. Fungicides used has active ingredient as Mancozeb 1875g/ha. Insecticides used has active ingredient as Profenofos 750g/ha, Cypermethrin 75g/ha. Machinery is used for soil cultivation with fuel consumption of 12.48 kg/ha using plough, hoeing, earthed up and rotary cultivator for soil tillage, Machines used for plant protection with fuel consumption of 2.08 kg/ha using Pesticides spray.   

This activity starts about nine weeks after the harvest of the previous crop. The soil is prepared for cultivation in December and sowing of seeds started about three weeks after soil preparation. Thereafter the crop is mature for harvesting in about 3 months.

The activity ends with the harvesting of the mature Onion plant.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0113:Growing of vegetables and melons, roots and tubers

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Soil cultivating date for the main crop: 28- December, 2016; Harvesting date main crop: 15-April, 2017. The soil cultivation, sowing and harvesting dates are taken as the middle date of the week or fortnight told to the data collector by the farmer. Total time from date of sowing to date of harvesting comes to 85 days.  The data is collected for one crop cycle. The cycle of one year is considered for entry in ecoeditor.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: village Vadner Bhairav, District Nashik of Maharashtra
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Cultivation of Onion follows conventional production standards
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Ecoinvent LCI calculation tool for crop production was used to calculate field emissions from the cultivation process. Number of wet days have been taken for the district (Nashik) and rainfall data is Normal rainfall for Madhya Maharashtra where the farm is located.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: The farmer was identified and contacted by agriculture science faculty familiar with the local farmers in the region. Data was collected directly from the farmer through semi-structured interview using a questionnaire based on the input requirements of the ecoinvent LCI calculation tool for crop production. The farmer does not maintain any written records and has provided the data from recent memory. In this region, typically farmers are unable to provide exact name of active ingredient in the pesticide they use and the same was noted from details given on the pesticide packet. Individual farmer is not able to calculate fuel consumption for his own farm alone and this information has been collected from farming community of the area.

exchanges.description: Total amount of active substance/s of fertilisers needed for the production of 'onion' is calculated to be circa 1.19E-02 kg. Fertiliser/s used in this dataset is/are: 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'potassium chloride, as K2O', 'potassium fertiliser, as K2O', 'urea, as N'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of fertiliser/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 2.37E-02 kg of packaging for fertilisers is justified with this exchange.
